metadata.title: CVE-2023-52752 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: smb:client: fix use-after-free bug in cifs_debug_data_proc_show() Skip SMBsessions that are being teared down (e.g. @ses->ses_status == SES_EXITING)in cifs_debug_data_proc_show() to avoid use-after-free in @ses. This fixesthe following GPF when reading from /proc/fs/cifs/DebugData while mountingand umounting [ 816.251274] general protection fault, probably fornon-canonical address 0x6b6b6b6b6b6b6d81: 0000 [#1] PREEMPT SMP NOPTI ... [816.260138] Call Trace: [ 816.260329] <TASK> [ 816.260499] ?die_addr+0x36/0x90 [ 816.260762] ? exc_general_protection+0x1b3/0x410 [816.261126] ? asm_exc_general_protection+0x26/0x30 [ 816.261502] ?cifs_debug_tcon+0xbd/0x240 [cifs] [ 816.261878] ?cifs_debug_tcon+0xab/0x240 [cifs] [ 816.262249]cifs_debug_data_proc_show+0x516/0xdb0 [cifs] [ 816.262689] ?seq_read_iter+0x379/0x470 [ 816.262995] seq_read_iter+0x118/0x470 [816.263291] proc_reg_read_iter+0x53/0x90 [ 816.263596] ?srso_alias_return_thunk+0x5/0x7f [ 816.263945] vfs_read+0x201/0x350 [816.264211] ksys_read+0x75/0x100 [ 816.264472] do_syscall_64+0x3f/0x90 [816.264750] entry_SYSCALL_64_after_hwframe+0x6e/0xd8 [ 816.265135] RIP:0033:0x7fd5e669d381

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52752` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-227-generic - 4.15.0-227.239
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-227-generic - 4.15.0-227.239
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-227-lowlatency - 4.15.0-227.239
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-192-generic - 5.4.0-192.212~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-192-lowlatency - 5.4.0-192.212~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-227.239').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-192.212~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1154.159').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1170.183').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.3').

linux-aws-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1130.140~18.04.1').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-5.3').
linux-azure-4.15 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1179.194').
linux-azure-5.3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-5.4').
linux-azure-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1135.142~18.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1125.136').
linux-aws-fips package in fips-updates/bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-2109.115').

linux-gkeop-5.4: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').

linux-oracle package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1133.144').
